projectPurpose: To provide a robust, extensible, and performant library in Rust for tokenizing and parsing SQL queries into a structured Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) for use in applications like database engines and analysis tools.
mainFeatures: Extensible SQL lexer and parser
Parses SQL into an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST)
Supports ANSI/ISO SQL standard and various dialects
Hand-written parser design for performance and extensibility
Allows reconstructing SQL text from AST
Includes source spans for improved error reporting

alternatives.name: ANTLR
mainFeatures: Parser generator from grammar files
Generates lexers and parsers in multiple languages
Widely used for building custom language parsers
Provides AST generation

alternatives.name: JSQLParser
mainFeatures: RDBMS agnostic SQL statement parser
Supports multiple SQL dialects (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.)
Translates SQL into a traversable AST (Java classes)
Built from JavaCC

alternatives.name: sqlparse
mainFeatures: Non-validating SQL parser
Supports parsing, splitting, and formatting SQL
Uses regular expressions for parsing

alternatives.name: libpg_query
mainFeatures: Standalone PostgreSQL parser extracted from the source
Provides bindings for various languages
Parses PostgreSQL dialect SQL
Generates parse trees

alternatives.name: Apache Calcite
mainFeatures: Parser and optimizer framework
Supports pluggable architectures for dialects and data sources
Used as a foundation for query engines
Provides a SQL parser and logical plan representation

alternatives.name: General SQL Parser
mainFeatures: Supports numerous database dialects
Provides detailed SQL analysis and AST
Features include SQL formatting, validation, and rewriting
Commercial support available

alternatives.name: Microsoft.SqlServer.TransactSql.ScriptDom
mainFeatures: Parses Transact-SQL (T-SQL) dialect
Generates an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST)
Used for T-SQL code analysis and manipulation

alternatives.name: SQLGlot
mainFeatures: SQL parser, transpiler, optimizer, and engine
Supports translating between many SQL dialects
Pure Python, no dependencies
Provides AST analysis and manipulation

marketPositioning: sqlparser-rs is a leading open-source, general-purpose SQL parser library specifically tailored for the Rust programming language ecosystem. It distinguishes itself through a hand-written parser design that prioritizes performance, ease of extension for custom dialects, and simplified debugging compared to parser generators. While it aims for broad ANSI/ISO SQL compliance and dialect support, its primary market position is as a foundational component for building robust and performant data processing tools, databases, and query engines written in Rust, as demonstrated by its adoption in projects like Apache DataFusion and Ballista. It competes with general-purpose parsers in other languages and parser generator tools, but is the prominent choice for Rust developers needing native SQL parsing capabilities.
